answers.a: A type of database that only stores text-based records in a hierarchical format.
answers.b: A centralized database managed by a single entity or organization.
answers.c: A decentralized and distributed ledger where data is stored in blocks that are chained together.

questions.question: What is the difference between conventional and blockchain database?

answers.a: Conventional databases typically allow for easy modification or deletion of records, while blockchain databases ensure that once data is added, it becomes immutable.
answers.b: Conventional databases can only store image files, while blockchain databases can store all file types.
answers.c: Conventional databases are typically centralized and managed by a single entity, while blockchain databases are decentralized and distributed ledgers where data is secured using cryptographic principles.
answers.d: Conventional databases are only accessible online, while blockchain databases can be accessed both online and offline.
